titleStmt.title: H. R. Conner et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9385

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency Govenor Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonweath of Kentucky

Your petitioners would most respectfully represent to your honor that the case of John Self who was fined at the March Term of the Bath Circuit Court ^1860^ for retailing spiritous liquors to a minor is a meritorous case and deserves the intervention of Executive clemency he is a poor hard working young man and at the time the act was committed was not aware that such a law existed all of which is respectfuly submitted to your Excellency

H. R. Conner
George Spencer
Joshua Ewing
John McCue
Joseph Toy
Wiley Gardner
Andrew P. Manley
Hanson Capiher
James rager
thomas Jackson
